bibl.title: Writ, John Sevier to Sheriff of Washington County, North Carolina 1784

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: To the Sheriff of Washington Co

We command you to take William Hall planter if in your Bailwick and him Safely keep so that you have him before the Justices of our County Court of pleas and quarter Sessions to be Held on the first Monday in August next then and there to answer William Trimble in a plea of debt damage fifty pounds Specie
Herein fail not and Have you there this Writ. Witness John Sevier Clerke of our Said Court at office the first monday in May Anno Domini 1784
